title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 June 2009 - XWiki
content:
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 00:11  
marta\_ left at 00:28 ("Leaving.")  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 00:52  
tharindu left at 01:04 (Remote closed the connection)  
arunreddy left at 01:26 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 01:49  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 01:50): Hi cristinas  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 01:50): Still up?  
cristinas - (06/06/2009 01:51): hi!  
cristinas - (06/06/2009 01:51): yes  
cristinas - (06/06/2009 01:51): looking in the OO sdk ..   
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 01:52): Any luck so far?  
cristinas - (06/06/2009 01:52): I can't use a dialog for the navigation panel because the user cannot change the focus or minimize the dialog  
cristinas - (06/06/2009 01:53): so i've tried another component Xwindow .. but I don't know how to add controls in this one  
cypromis left at 02:02 ()  
vmassol left at 02:29 ()  
cristinas - (06/06/2009 02:36): I found a solution for my problem .. I'm going to sleep now Bye!  
cristinas left at 02:37 ("Leaving")  
florinciu left at 02:46 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.10/2009042316]")  
arunreddy joined #xwiki at 03:19  
jvelociter left at 03:30 ()  
sdumitriu left at 03:32 ("Leaving.")  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 07:40  
glerouge left at 07:43 (Client Quit)  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:01  
arunreddy - (06/06/2009 09:09): vmassol : Hi  
arunreddy - (06/06/2009 09:10): I have commited some source code. A module to parse the input ( Exported MediaWiki Xml Dump ) and create pages out of it.  
arunreddy - (06/06/2009 09:11): Can i have some comments.  
vmassol - (06/06/2009 09:17): arunreddy: not now but I'll try to review asap  
arunreddy - (06/06/2009 09:17): Sure, Thanks.  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 09:33  
trifon left at 09:52 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 10:11  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:19  
alexmaru joined #xwiki at 10:26  
trifon joined #xwiki at 10:33  
alexmaru left at 10:40 ("good bye")  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:46  
vmassol left at 11:00 ()  
anamarias left at 11:03 ()  
arunreddy\_ joined #xwiki at 11:23  
arunreddy left at 11:42 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
cristinas joined #xwiki at 11:51  
cristinas left at 11:57 ("Leaving")  
tachirei joined #xwiki at 12:57  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 12:58  
tachirei left #xwiki at 13:02  
tuska joined #xwiki at 13:47  
guillaum1 joined #xwiki at 14:10  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:40): Hi arunreddy\_  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:40): Around?  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:40): hi sdumitriu.  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:42): sdumitriu: ping.  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:43): I committed some changes to your project  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:43): Please update  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:44): Thanks  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:44): :)  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:44): I'll commit something else in a few minutes  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:44): Right now I broke your test  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:44): Have few doubts  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:45): In TDD .. write some code.. write tests for it and make sure the result is green all the time.  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:46): Yes  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:46): In this process can we start to build with some code not so organised. Suppose i have only mediawiki and that too it supports only XML form of input type.  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:47): Yes  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:47): So can i go with it now .. and make sure it works.. and later extend it to others  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:47): Yes  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:47): Adding inheritance.. interfaces.. and further abstraction..  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:47): Just want to know whether thats the right approach. Thanks.  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:47): :)  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:48): Yes, that is good  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:49): But, in order to be sure the architecture is right, it would be better to have two implementations with a common interface, so that the interface works for two different wikis  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:50): Committed again  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:50): Now the test works  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:50): You know, there's a third step in the TDD process, cleanup and refactoring  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:51): After the test passes, think how to make the code better  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:51): Using an imput stream instead of a file is always better  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 14:52): Files are tied to the filesystem, input streams can cover all kinds of inputs  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:56): OK.  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 14:57): Whats the difference with.  Embeddable, Default and Plexus Component Managers.  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:00): Where did you see that?  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:00): What's the context?  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:03): To use XWiki-Rendering-module  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:03): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/RenderingModule.  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:04): It uses a component manager to look up the particular parser class. ( MediaWiki, Confluence, XHtml, ..... )  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:04): and parses the input based on that  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:05): You should use the default one  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:05): DefaultComponentManager.  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:05): The embeddable is developped by Vincent during the last few days, and it's a simple component manager that can be used by XWiki  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:06): The plexus one is, well, Plexus  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:06): The default points to one of those  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:06): Confused  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:06): DefaultComponentManager or PlexusComponentManager. ?  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:09): Wait...  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:09): What are you trying to do?  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:09): Use it in the code?  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:10): Yes.  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:10): Hm...  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:10): Let me check  
tuska left at 15:10 ("Ex-Chat")  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:10): The text which i get from the xml file. ( MediaWiki Syntax )  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:11): i want to parse it using the existing parser which gives me XDOM  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:12): Vincent asked me to use a component manager to look up the parser. As described in XWiki  Rendering Module  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:14): Am i understandable ?  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:14): Yes  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:14): Hm...  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:14): I don't know...  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:16): ok. :)  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:17): Well, I guess you can use any of those, since they share a common API  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:17): Vincent will tell you which one is better  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:18): Sure. Will ask vincent once he is back.  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:18): Coming to UI part. Is there any one working on the Wizard Class.  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:19): Not yet  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:22): OK. Should the wizard be embedded into XWiki page. or Pop up window.   
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:23): Are there any UI Guidelines for XWiki.?  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:24): Inside XWiki page  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:25): Not really, but it should be consistent with the rest of the wiki  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:25): But you should not insist on the UI  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:25): We'll come with suggestions if something is wrong  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:25): Make a mockup first  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 15:26): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Mockups/ImportExportWiki  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:28): Ok  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:28): yes i will do that.  
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:28): Thanks   
arunreddy\_ - (06/06/2009 15:28): :)  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 16:19  
tuska joined #xwiki at 17:06  
tuska left at 17:25 ("Ex-Chat")  
tuska joined #xwiki at 17:52  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 18:38  
vmassol left at 19:13 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 19:18  
arunreddy\_\_ joined #xwiki at 19:23  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:40): Does anyone knows an easy way to make an xmlrpc call using xwiki and groovy ?  
arunreddy\_ left at 19:40 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:41): I tried using the XMLRpcClient that should be bundled with groovy, but using XE 1.8.4 I got a class not found in the logs  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:42): /XMLRpcClient/XMLRPCServerProxy/  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:43): Ok seems like I need a jar to usr the groovy client  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:44): Is there any client bundle with xwiki ?  
vmassol left at 19:50 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
arunreddy\_\_ - (06/06/2009 19:54): xipe : Hi, Copy the groovy-xmlrpc-jar into XE WEB-INF/lib --   
arunreddy\_\_ - (06/06/2009 19:54): it works  
arunreddy\_\_ - (06/06/2009 19:54): Link to jar : http://repository.codehaus.org/org/codehaus/groovy/groovy-xmlrpc/0.4/groovy-xmlrpc-0.4.jar  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:55): Ok, but we don't have anything included ?  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:55): anyway I will use this jar it will be easier  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:55): thanls  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:55): thanks  
arunreddy\_\_ - (06/06/2009 19:55): I dunno much about it. But when i used groovy-xmlrpc, I got the same error.  
arunreddy\_\_ - (06/06/2009 19:56): I used the jar and it worked well for me.  
arunreddy\_\_ - (06/06/2009 19:56): :)  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:56): Yes it works  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:56): Another question btw  
arunreddy\_\_ - (06/06/2009 19:56): i will try. :)  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:57): in velocity I use $util  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:57): but from groovy it seems like util is not in the context  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:57): Is it normal ot is it a bug ?  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:57): /ot/or/  
marta\_ - (06/06/2009 19:58): xipe: if i remember correctly, that's a known bug  
arunreddy\_\_ - (06/06/2009 19:58): No clue. Am sorry. Am a gsoc student here.   
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:59): ok, so I will instantiate it by myself  
xipe - (06/06/2009 19:59): thanks  
lucaa - (06/06/2009 19:59): xipe: yes it is a bug, I've heard about it these days  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:01): ok, thanks  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:03): seems like I have the same problem with the xwiki object  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:03): from groovy I get : No such property: xwiki for class: ClientGroovy  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:04): Is it the same problem, or have I missed something ?  
marta\_ - (06/06/2009 20:04): yes, the same pb  
marta\_ - (06/06/2009 20:04): the context is not well defined  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:06): ok, seems weird I don't get how groovy apps we have everywhere can work without this  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:07): If I go back to 1.7 or 1.6, is there a chance that I get it working correctly ?  
marta\_ - (06/06/2009 20:09): XWIKI-3932  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:10): Oh, it's very new  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:10): I will try 1.8.3  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:11): thank you marta\_   
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:12): Do we know when 1.8.5 will be released ?  
sdumitriu - (06/06/2009 20:14): No  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:15): ok  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:21): Seems like the bug is present in 1.8.3 too  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:21): Which version can I use ?  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:24): we don't plan to release a 1.8.5 at all  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:25): xipe: as you can see in the jira issue the fix will come with 1.9RC2  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:25): so for now it's on 1.9-SNAPSHOT  
arunreddy\_\_ left at 20:26 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:26): So we let the 1.8 broken ? When will the final 1.9 released ?  
tuska left at 20:27 ("Ex-Chat")  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:27): I really need a stable working version for production which I can use to make groovy scripts  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:27): Even if I have to go back to 1.5, 1.6 o 1.7 that's not a problem for me  
tuska joined #xwiki at 20:28  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:28): for tuska:  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:28): xipe: also note that this is only about 2.0 macro  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:28): No I am using 1.0 syntax  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:28): It does not work with 1.0  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:28): the 1.0 groovy macro is supposed to work well  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:28): That's a huge problem  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:29): No here ;)  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:29): all issue taged with "Rendering 2.0" are only bout rendering 2.0, now for 1.0 i don't know i never use it  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:29): you should report it  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:30): But do you know if 1.6 or 1.7 was working ?  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:30): no i have no idea, as i said i nevr use 1.0 groovy macro  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:31): but i'm pretty sure this was working since Ludo is doing lots of groovy  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:31): even in 1.8.x in fect  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:31): fact  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:31): But it works in pages, it only does not work in groovy page called using parseGroovyFromPage  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:31): for example there is some groovy script for EMC which is useing 1.8 branch  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:32): ha ok I understood that's groovy did not worked at all  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:32): maybe  parseGroovyFromPage is using a specific groovy context  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:33): but nothing change here since a very long time AFAIK  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:33): are you sure this worked ?  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:33): I am pretty sure yes  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:34): Let me try on our pro farm  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:34): anyway you should create a jira issue about this as soon as possible, if it's a regession it's blocker for 1.9RC2  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:36): seems it was not working in 1.3  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:37): perhaps I am not using it the way it should  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:38): why do you need xwiki/context in parseGroovyFromPage ? this as been more designed to parse a groovy class to use in a velocity script or groovy AFAIK  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:39): if you just want to execute groovy from java you should look at how scheduler plugin works  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:40): (vtw 1.9 final is planed for next week)  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:42): I need to access th utils and xwiki.getDocuments() from a groovy class  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:42): the class is called from velocity  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:43): And I don't want to pass util, context and xwiki every time I call a function  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:45): isn't there a way to pass it to the constructor ?  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:46): seems not  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:46): or you simply use a init method  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:47): like in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Notifications  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:47): looks like it's "normal"  
tuska - (06/06/2009 20:47): to not have access to xwiki/context/etc in a groovy class  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:47): weird  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:47): I will do that  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:48): but it's quite "unfonctional"  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:52): ok it works  
xipe - (06/06/2009 20:53): thanks  
tuska - (06/06/2009 21:09): np  
tuska left at 21:09 ("Ex-Chat")  
florinciu left at 23:41 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.10/2009042316]")
